title: I've had 7 "One For All" games in a row with an intentional feeder.
body:
It seems people are feeding and trolling for fun in the Featured game mode. Sometimes it's my team, sometimes it's the enemy team. They usually type something along the lines of 'should have voted for  ________' or ' ________ deserves to lose for voting for ____' . 

It's ruining the featured game mode,  every game I've had today has been decided within the first 10 seconds once someone types "feeding".

{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}} 

TLDR:
IF YOU QUEUE FOR "One For All", PLAY THE GAME! Or dodge at the very least....
Don't feed so it will be over faster and you can vote again....

replies.body:
Another sucky thing is people are playing the same champs over and over again.
I JUST WANT TO PLAY MY URGOT!!

> [{quoted}](name=Ligerzz,realm=OCE,application-id=cIfEodbz,discussion-id=eyPMqu1E,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-10-17T21:56:34.039+0000)
>
> Another sucky thing is people are playing the same champs over and over again.
> I JUST WANT TO PLAY MY URGOT!!

I know your pain been trying to get a Trundle game going for two days now...  {{champion:48}} {{item:3070}}

Or you can, ya know, dodge?

Better to take a small time penalty instead of wasting fifteen-twenty minutes of your time, only to be possibly punished harsher for purposely feeding. Some people are just plain unreasonable.
or ya know just don't play ofa
Maybe he wants to enjoy this limited time game mode, ya know?
It's 5 minutes the first time and 15 minutes the second time, but after that it takes more time to dodge than it does to troll. And I think people would have more than 2 bad queues in a row.
Its actually 6 minutes.

True...

Depends on what you define as a bad queue. Majority voted a champion you don't like? If you used up your dodges, it might be better to give it a shot (Bard was a very interesting game for me...). 

But no matter how you cut it, there's no excuse to be an asshole and troll a game over a game mode like this. If you dodge twice and are seriously considering trolling if you won't get a champion you like, I suggest either getting a premade set up or playing normal SR if you can't handle the featured game mode that shouldn't be taken too seriously.

I understand,
I was playing with one of my friends, who was low level, and he really wanted to play ekko.
He got lucky with the lottery pick, however the others were complaining that they didn't want to play him.
So, during the laning phase, against ezreal, our team didn't do well except for mid.
They kept spamming surrender at every time they could. however i always pressed no because i was carrying, with a quadra kill.
However after 30 mins in the game, they sold all their items for troll items.
Me and my friend were basically the only ones trying, however my friend got tired of the trolls and surrendered, leaving me the only one saying no.
Its just ridiculous how childish the match was and how we would of won if we worked together instead of trolling .:c
Here's the match:
http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/1981391800/228693290?tab=overview

Remove majority rules
I hate that crap and it makes me want to feed

at least make it actually like a goddamn gamble of 
60%/40%
60%/20%/20%
80%/20%
Think I fell asleep while playing a game of it.
yup it sucks :/ ive gotten people that threw the game cause we didnt go tahm kench, like seriously tahm kench isnt even fun or good in the game mode.

Actually, with teamwork, Team Kench is terrifying. I played against one once, they all had teleport so they were always everywhere, and they were all so tanky that we couldn't burst them down


We were playing Veigar
You can beat Tahm with with organized kite mages, like zyra or xerath. Veigar is only burst, and once people get tanky he's hard to pull off. (Happened when my nautilus team beat another veigar team)
Can't Bench the Kench. Friends and I played Kench in all for one and beat a bunch of stun spamming bards :D

Had an intentional feeder in All for one. Thankfully we were all singed, so despite this guy  feeding super hard (going like 1/24/3 or something) we completely destroyed the enemy Azirs by the end of the game.

Two things:

1) Didn't they institute a new "feeder buster" that was supposed to exist? Rito why the hell does your system not filter for people saying they intend to feed and at least give them some form of punishment (maybe not a full on punishment if they end up not feeding, but at least treat it like toxic speech).

2) Did they make sure to distribute their feeding evenly across the 5 enemies so that they by themselves could provide food for all the enemies as just one feeder? (And they said "this one shall be for all, do not spare him out of mercy for he is the offering that you may be fed" and so it was done)
I've been playing leona so many times like wtf. She's not fun pls stop
I thought I was the only fucking one getting intentional feeders in OFA.
I always have at least one person who disconnects for like a quarter of the game :/

I feel sorry for you :/
Now I'm glad I haven't had that luck, and I know I don't pull that shit, even when stuck with a champ I can't play for shit >.<
Holy moly dude you have terrible luck or I have great luck. Haven't experienced this yet
it was just bad luck. i played some games, i only experienced some people blaming (especially when we went as morde vs zac ~~and lost~~)
Its kinda typical to find kids like this on the weekend to show up alot. Just the truth of playing a free to play online game.

the problem is that people take troll picks and ruin the game for everyone else.  i had a chance to play darius, and we had multiple votes for him, then someone else picked zac and guess who the enemy team took?  did you guess darius?  you were right.  we got SLAGUHTERED.

Ive also had to suffer through games with yasuo, bard, thresh... and yes, some champs im accusing of being troll picks ARE GOOD, but only if you know how to use them, and have runes/masteries for them.  its not fun being forced to play a champ youve neve rused before without runes, masteries, and all becuase ONE GUY wanted to play his main instead of the champ everyone else wanted.
Feeding is never good, but better they get it out of there system (and Riot gets them out of the system) in a temp mode instead of ranked.
